items.title: Manchester derby buildup, a big day for Frank and Nuno, and more ‚Äì matchday live
items.summary: News, buildup and discussion before day‚Äôs action Post a question for Jamie Jackson BTL | Email us here With United out of both cup competitions and not playing in Europe this season, Will Unwin poses the question of whether this is the club‚Äôs post-Ferguson nadir ‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs fair enough to suggest so, but nothing will surely top be worse than losing to 17th-placed Spurs in the worst Europa League final of all time (TM), all the while finishing 15th. Sorry Ruben. Continue reading...

items.title: Carrick negeert meningen van Man United-pundits: 'Irrelevant'
items.summary: Manchester United-interim Michael Carrick trekt zich niets aan van meningen van buitenaf. Dat enkele oud-spelers en pundits een flinke vinger in de pap hebben, maakt Carrick weinig uit.

items.title: ADO Den Haag ziet ruime voorsprong verdampen: 'Nee, er is niets aan de hand'
items.summary: Op 7 november 2025 zei Cambuur-trainer Henk de Jong dat ADO Den Haag niet meer in te halen was op de ranglijst, maar op 17 januari ziet het er allemaal heel anders uit. Bij ADO maken ze zich niet druk.

items.title: Tractor Girls‚Äô small army plough on in FA Cup after major off-field overhaul
items.summary: Ipswich may be bottom of WSL2, but have big plans as new management team aim to turn their season around Ipswich Town go into their Women‚Äôs FA Cup tie on Sunday against fellow WSL2 side Sheffield United with the pressure off and spirits high. The Tractor Girls are having a tough debut season in the second tier in the WSL era of women‚Äôs domestic football. They are bottom of the league, five points behind Portsmouth and Durham, with Portsmouth having played a game more. They return to their former Felixstowe home on Sunday for the FA Cup fourth round, having had to make the switch to Colchester to meet the WSL2 ground requirements for league matches. Continue reading...

items.title: ADO en Cambuur op promotiekoers: 'Het mag eigenlijk niet meer misgaan'
items.summary: Cambuur won voor de tweede keer dit seizoen van ADO Den Haag en deed goede zaken in de Keuken Kampioen Divisie. Het verschil bedraagt nog twee punten (met een wedstrijd minder gespeeld) in Haags voordeel, maar in Leeuwarden en Den Haag kunnen ze zich opmaken voor promotie naar de Eredivisie.

items.title: VI Live: koploper PSV gaat op bezoek bij Fortuna Sittard
items.summary: PSV gaat zaterdagavond op bezoek bij Fortuna Sittard. De ploeg van Peter Bosz jaagt op de dertiende Eredivisie-zege op rij. Of dat lukt, volg je in deze VI Live.

items.title: VI Live: druk op zowel Manchester United als Manchester City in derby
items.summary: Zaterdagmiddag staan er niet alleen vijf wedstrijden in de Eredivisie op het programma, maar ook in het buitenland staan ons veel mooie potjes te wachten. Te beginnen met de Manchester Derby om 13.30 uur, gevolgd door onder meer Real Madrid, Liverpool, Arsenal, Bayern M√ºnchen en Internazionale. Volg het (inter)nationale voetbal in deze VI Live.

items.title: England's Parry one shot off halfway lead in Hawaii
items.summary: A late dropped shot left England's John Parry one shot off the halfway lead in the PGA Tour season-opening Sony Open in Hawaii.

items.title: 'I heard a desire to continue fighting' - Usyk reveals Joshua conversation
items.summary: Oleksandr Usyk says a conversation he has had with Anthony Joshua since the Brit survived a fatal car crash in Nigeria has convinced him that his heavyweight rival has "a desire to continue" fighting.

items.title: Who will become the 'disrupter' to Alcaraz and Sinner in 2026?
items.summary: Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner have shared the last eight Grand Slams between them so who can become the "disrupter" and break the monopoly?

items.title: Il Etait Temps takes on Jonbon in Clarence House
items.summary: Il Etait Temps and last year's winner Jonbon clash in the latest renewal of the BetMGM Clarence House Chase this afternoon - live on Sky Sports Racing.

items.title: 'Results, results' - how Guardiola outlasted five Man Utd bosses
items.summary: Pep Guardiola takes on a sixth different Manchester United boss in Saturday's derby as he approaches a decade at City, but how has he outlasted all of those before Michael Carrick?

items.title: Sources: Miami eyeing Berterame in $15M deal
items.summary: Inter Miami is prepared to pay the $15 million release clause for Monterrey forward Germ√°n Berterame, sources told ESPN.

items.title: Transfer request from teen starlet stuns Bar√ßa
items.summary: Barcelona have been left stunned after teenager Dro Fern√°ndez informed the club of his desire to leave this January by exercising his ‚Ç¨6 million ($7m) release clause, sources have told ESPN.

items.title: USMNT's Sargent banished to Norwich U21s
items.summary: Norwich City manager Philippe Clement revealed that USMNT striker Josh Sargent has been sent to play with the club's under-21s following his refusal to take part in last weekend's FA Cup match against Walsall.

items.title: Senegal demand 'equal treatment' for AFCON final
items.summary: The Senegalese Football Federation filed a formal complaint ahead of Sunday's Africa Cup of Nations final against Morocco, citing a failure to provide adequate security, accommodation, training facilities, and fair ticket allocations.

items.title: 'Nix is like a dog on a leash' - Schecter on why Bills have hope at Broncos
items.summary: Denver Broncos quarterback Bo Nix still needing to be manipulated like "a dog on a leash" gives Josh Allen hope of extending the Buffalo Bills' playoff run, according to Phoebe Schecter.

items.title: Former Man Utd players' comments 'irrelevant' - Carrick
items.summary: Michael Carrick brands the noise generated around Manchester United by former players "irrelevant" and says Roy Keane's personal comments did not bother him.

items.title: Frank must beware ghost of Tottenham managers past to avoid Nuno‚Äôs fate
items.summary: Manager aware his reign has parallels to the Spurs spell of his counterpart at West Ham, Saturday‚Äôs visitors When Thomas Frank glances along the touchline at Nuno Esp√≠rito Santo on Saturday afternoon, he will see more than the ghost of Tottenham managers past. Because during his darkest hours ‚Äì and there have been a few of those during a fraught first season at the club ‚Äì he may also have seen a vision of his own future. The parallels between the two are clear and they are difficult to ignore as Nuno makes his return to Spurs with West Ham, desperate for a result to help lift the club out of the relegation places. When Nuno went to Spurs in 2021, he did so as a manager who had made his name in English football with Wolves, getting them promoted from the Championship and going on to enjoy success with them in the top division. Ditto Frank with Brentford before his move to Spurs last summer. Continue reading...

items.title: The dramatic 24 hours that sealed Guehi and Glasner's futures
items.summary: BBC Sport looks at a dramatic 24 hours for Crystal Palace as captain Marc Guehi agrees to join Manchester City and manager Oliver Glasner confirms he is leaving in the summer.
